Text: Allows building structures such as Platforms over plants.
Allows planting directly on roofs and platforms without soil. These plants receive irrigation and contamination from the land below.
Prevents land contamination from being brought up. Enables planting trees or crops on platforms even if the land below is unsuitable.

Growth options: - Trees: Log providing plants that are planted by Foresters (e.g. Pine, Oak). - Crops: Food providing plants that are planted by Farmers and Bushes (e.g. Carrots, Blueberry and Dandelion Bushes). - Products: Resources growing on trees after they mature (e.g. Pine Resin, Blueberries).

Multiplier for tree growth time.
Default: ×1. Set below ×1 to decrease difficulty. Example: ×0.5 makes a Chestnut that normally takes 23 days to grow take 11.5 days.

Multiplier for crop growth time.
Default: ×1. Set below ×1 to decrease difficulty. Example: ×0.5 makes a Potato that normally takes 5 days to grow take 2.5 days.

Multiplier for product growth time.
Default: ×1. Set below ×1 to decrease difficulty. Example: ×0.5 makes Pine Resin that normally takes 7 days to grow take 3.5 days.

Multiplier for log output when cutting down trees (rounded down).
Default: ×1. Set above ×1 to increase output. Example: ×1.5 makes a Pine that normally yields 2 Logs yield 3 Logs.

Multiplier for crop output when harvesting crops (rounded down).
Default: ×1. Set above ×1 to increase output. Example: ×1.5 makes a Carrot harvest that normally yields 3 Carrots yield 4 Carrots.

Multiplier for product output when gathering products (rounded down).
Default: ×1. Set above ×1 to increase output. Example: ×1.5 makes Pine Resin that normally yields 2 Resin yield 3 Resin.

Adjusts the chance for trees to reproduce each hour (default: 1–3% depending on type).
Default: ×1. ×0 disables reproduction. Example: ×2 makes a Pine with a base 3% chance reproduce at 6% chance.
